name: Eiffel Tower
clues: I was built for a World Fair in the late 19th century
At the time of my construction, many Parisians thought I was an eyesore
I was the tallest man-made structure in the world for 41 years
facts: The Eiffel Tower was built by Gustave Eiffel for the 1889 World's Fair
It stands 330 meters (1,083 ft) tall and was the tallest structure in the world until 1930
The tower was originally intended to be a temporary structure
The tower is repainted every 7 years with 60 tons of paint

name: Machu Picchu
clues: I was built in the 15th century but remained unknown to the outside world until 1911
I sit nearly 8,000 feet above sea level between two mountain peaks
My name means 'old peak' or 'old mountain' in the Quechua language
facts: Machu Picchu was built around 1450 CE at the height of the Inca Empire
It was abandoned just over 100 years later, in 1572, as a result of the Spanish Conquest
It was declared a UNESCO World Heritage Site in 1983
The site is made up of more than 150 buildings ranging from baths and houses to temples and sanctuaries

name: Great Barrier Reef
clues: I can be seen from space and am the world's largest living structure
I'm home to more than 1,500 species of fish
I'm composed of billions of tiny organisms
facts: The Great Barrier Reef is the world's largest coral reef system
It is composed of over 2,900 individual reefs and 900 islands
It supports a wide diversity of life and was selected as a World Heritage Site in 1981
The reef is facing numerous threats including climate change, pollution, and overfishing
